author: Tom Powell
title: Mother and son stabbed to death at home while company boss father is seriously injured in hospital
text:
A 13-year-old boy and his mother have been stabbed to death at their home near Birmingham, police said.. 
They were discovered along with the woman's husband at the house in Stourbridge shortly after 8am on Thursday. 
A West Midlands Police spokesman said the woman, aged in her 50s, was pronounced dead at the scene and the teenager was pronounced dead in hospital. 
The husband, named locally as company director Peter Wilkinson, is fighting for life in hospital with stab wounds to his chest and back. 
Detectives said a man aged in his 20s was arrested in a nearby road 30 minutes later in a Land Rover stolen from the scene. Crime scene: a 13-year-old boy and his mother were stabbed at their home in Stourbridge (PA) 
Superintendent Lee Kendrick, said: "Clearly our investigation is at a very early stage but we understand the suspect was known to the family and may have been living at the address - although he is not a family relative. 
"We don't think this was a burglary or a robbery." 
Mr Kendrick added: "What has unfolded here this morning is horrific and heart-breaking. Police and ambulance were confronted with an awful scene: a man, woman and boy all with very serious stab injuries. West Midlands Police Officers speak at the scene (PA) 
"The woman and boy were found in the house and the man in the garden." 
He added: "Our investigation is progressing at pace and we are working to understand exactly what the relationship was between the man and the family. A man aged in his 20s was arrested in a nearby road (PA) 
"At this stage we are not looking for anyone else in connection with the incident." 
A West Midlands Ambulance Service spokesman said: "Unfortunately, despite the best efforts of ambulance staff it became apparent at the scene that nothing could be done to save the woman and she was confirmed deceased. Read more
